BeginDeallocate(IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations, String, String, String) BeginDeallocate(IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations, String, String, String)

Edit

Deallocates a specific virtual machine in a VM scale set. Shuts down the virtual machine and releases the compute resources it uses. You are not billed for the compute resources of this virtual machine once it is deallocated.

public static OperationStatusResponse BeginDeallocate(this IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations operations, string resourceGroupName, string vmScaleSetName, string instanceId)<ExtensionAttribute>
Public Shared Function BeginDeallocate(operations As IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations, resourceGroupName As String, vmScaleSetName As String, instanceId As String) As OperationStatusResponse

IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations

The operations group for this extension method.

resourceGroupName
String String

The name of the resource group.

vmScaleSetName
String String

The name of the VM scale set.

instanceId
String String

The instance ID of the virtual machine.

Returns
OperationStatusResponse OperationStatusResponse

BeginPowerOff(IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations, String, String, String) BeginPowerOff(IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations, String, String, String)

Edit

Power off (stop) a virtual machine in a VM scale set. Note that resources are still attached and you are getting charged for the resources. Instead, use deallocate to release resources and avoid charges.

BeginReimageAll(IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations, String, String, String) BeginReimageAll(IVirtualMachineScaleSetVMsOperations, String, String, String)

Edit

Allows you to re-image all the disks ( including data disks ) in the a virtual machine scale set instance. This operation is only supported for managed disks.

Power off (stop) a virtual machine in a VM scale set. Note that resources are still attached and you are getting charged for the resources. Instead, use deallocate to release resources and avoid charges.
